data.title: A Matter of Earnestness (1965)
data.meta_description: Minister Andreas Mavrogialouros (Labros Konstadaras) visits the village of his electoral district, Platanias for the inauguration of a maternity hospital. After an accident, he finds his voters' dissatisfaction and the scams of his partners. He, therefore, decides to step down from the government and bring order to his life, starting from his wife and his daughter.
data.text:
It's REALLY great... until it's not. The first 2/3rds are some of the best and funniest that Greek cinema has produced. Then it becomes kinda... eh? Like, the main character becomes unnecessarily cruel and violent even to his own family. And it's supposed to be positive character development?

Yay, the protagonist understood that the system is corrupt! He will now beat his wife more to make things better.
